projectName: Madison Square Garden Sphere Entertainment Co.
shortDescription: Live entertainment and media company creating immersive and interactive experiences for the Sphere in Las Vegas.
longDescription: I was a Software Engineer Intern on the Simulation and Visualizations team, which develops a suite of software products and tools used internally for content production at the Sphere and other Madison Square Garden properties. I worked on a multiuser Virtual Reality and Desktop application that is used by creative, design, and capture teams at Sphere Entertainment for venue simulation and simulataneous media playback and reviewing.

As a Software Engineer Intern on SimVis, I documented and implemented a new user feature that enabled user interface panels to be moveable on both the Oculus Quest 2 and Desktop platforms. The feature provided users with greater flexibility in where panels are placed and increased users' experience when navigating the tool overall. When implementing this feature, I...

Enhanced an in-built debug panel used by developers, tackling and resolving feature-breaking bugs and implementing additional features that optimized the build testing pipeline.
Communicated remotely with engineers to discuss and debug technical challenges faced during implementation.
Participated in daily lightning and biweekly burndown meetings.
